Description: Wall sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with two bands in dark added red above an undetermined motif in red with added white outline; exterior, from top: part of maeander pattern, dot and billet frieze, reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The light on dark figure decoration (as possibly in this case) on the interior surface of chalices is rare and found only in the Grand Style.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 20.6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0774) (phase 2)
